TopicTitle: [1.12.x] End your parts list nightmare - Introducing The Janitor's Closet

Articles.Content:
36 minutes ago, linuxgurugamer said:

The internal part names would be helpful

I believe these are what you need...

"Mite" is SolidBoosterFM1

"Shrimp" is SolidBoosterF3S0

"Kickback" is  MassiveBooster

"Pollux" is solidBoosterTHK.  It comes from Making History expansion.

22 minutes ago, 11Bravo49417 said:

I believe these are what you need...

"Mite" is SolidBoosterFM1

"Shrimp" is SolidBoosterF3S0

"Kickback" is  MassiveBooster

"Pollux" is solidBoosterTHK.  It comes from Making History expansion.  

That will be useful, thanks
Got some NRE's from janitor's closet showing up in the log again https://www.dropbox.com/s/3scy0xcu12zh7sn/KSP.log?dl=0

@linuxgurugamer When I uninstall other parts mods from an active save, the mod name remains selectable in TJC's filter window. It's easily fixable by deleting and reinstalling but that has the side-effect of removing any custom settings. Is there a better way to get TJC to stop listing an uninstalled parts mod?

I looked in gamedata and think that manually editing FilterConfig.cfg might do it. Search for the mod name and delete the row. Repeat that process in other files named JCModFilter[#].cfg. One thing that concerns me is if some parts from that mod were previously blocked. Do those blocked parts become clutter in some file (because blocking seems to be stored somewhere else than those cfg files) or cause other problems?

This isn't a big deal and reinstalling TJC is easy enough, but you might already know a better way. (My search for similar discussions found nothing.)

Hi @linuxgurugamer

Why is this mod not available in 1.8.x ? (I'm stuck in this version because a lot of mods I want to use don't work in 1.9.x)

I've been trying to use the latest version 1.9.0 of your mod but KSP freeze at startup ... and with CKAN I only see a 1.7.3 previous version ... can you publish a 1.8.x version please ?

Thanks,

LKS

Have you tried the 1.7.2 version in KSP 1.8?  It'll probably work as it does for me.

At least it used to.  I can confirm that in a modded KSP 1.8.1, pressing and holding the Alt key when clicking on a part in the VAB does not bring up the JC menu.

More investigation required.

Edited May 7, 2020 by Brigadier
I was wrong :-)

The version you should be using is 0.3.6.1, it works for both 1.8 and 1.9

I don't know what you mean by the "version 1.9.0"

Also, be sure to have ZeroMiniAVC installed, your crash/freeze most likely isn't this mod but something else.

By 1.9.0 I mean the version of KSP that is supposed to be compatible dixit CKAN as you can see here: https://imgur.com/a/0mycqt7

The 0.3.6.1 does'nt work ... KSP freeze at start on janitorscloset/textures/... and I have ZeroMiniAVC installed for KSP 1.8.1 ...

LKS

KSP freeze at start on janitorscloset/textures/...

Hi there, I'm experiencing the same issue that occasionally the game will hang once it starts to load Janitor's Closet.

It'll get to about here... 

[LOG 19:45:49.890] Load(Texture): JanitorsCloset/Textures/20_black-white
[LOG 19:45:49.911] Load(Texture): JanitorsCloset/Textures/20_blue-black

...and then hang...

Here's my full log: KSP_Log_050920-1945.log

What's odd, is that if I load KSP on a fresh restart of my machine, the game will usually load fine. But if I load KSP after sleep mode or if it's the 2nd game load in a day, it will often hang right at that spot. So far it hasn't hung at any other time since I've freshly installed this instance and these mods.

Running KSP 1.8.1 with Janitor's Closet v0.3.7 on Windows 10. I know in a previous comment, you recommended the 0.3.6.1 version of JC, but then the Spacedock notes say 0.3.7 was updated for KSP 1.8? I, too, have ZeroMiniAVC installed.

Thanks for your help!

You need to send the Player.log, which has the Unity info.

I experience this quite often as well, but it's nothing to do with JC, as far as I can tell.  It has to do with d3d11 errors.  and it's actually a behind-the-scene crash

For me, it happens right around the time the logo with the orbiting planets is shown in the lower right, it starts and then hangs.  All mods are loaded at this point, but it seems to happen after a number of the following errors: 

d3d11: failed to create 2D texture id=3859 width=10 height=10 mips=4 dxgifmt=77 [D3D error was 80070057]

It's interesting because I see the same error on my smaller games, and it doesn't crash.  So it has something to do with memory.

From your file, I see that you have a total of 16 gig of memory.  Would be interesting to see what happens to the main and GPU memory, for me, it gets very close to full.  I've started doing a full reboot of my computer before my streams because the 210+ mods that I am playing with are very memory intensive, both RAM and GPU.  Assuming you have an up-to-date version of W10, the task manager has been updated to show GPU information, in the Performance tab at the bottom of the list

 

Edited May 10, 2020 by linuxgurugamer
Guys, if I prune a part, and delete the mod, if I reinstall the mod I get the part back, right?

On 5/9/2020 at 8:23 PM, linuxgurugamer said:

I experience this quite often as well, but it's nothing to do with JC, as far as I can tell.  It has to do with d3d11 errors.  and it's actually a behind-the-scene crash 


d3d11: failed to create 2D texture id=3859 width=10 height=10 mips=4 dxgifmt=77 [D3D error was 80070057]

 

In my latest player.log (thanks for pointing that out), I can also see a ton of these d3d11 errors. But when I looked at my performance tab it didn't seem anything was maxed out.

Unfortunately, I've gotten three of these hang/crashes in a row, including a fresh restart on two of the occasions. I'd really love to find out what's causing this, if there's anything we can do about it.

But that's not for this thread, since as you say it doesn't appear to be a JC issue.
After I delete a mod its name still appears in the filter list. Is there anyway to remove it besides reinstalling JC

I don't know the answer for you, but if you try to investigate it more on your own take a look at my April 23 post. I did a little research into how JC settings worked.

8 hours ago, skzbr said:

Not working for me, it just doesnt appear on menu

You have to give more information than that if you want to receive assistance.  What doesn't appear where?  As well, follow the link in my signature and read the troubleshooting steps you should following, including finding the log file and uploading it to a file sharing site so you can post the link here.  Else there's very little that can be done to help you.

You have to give more information than that if you want to receive assistance.  What doesn't appear where?  As well, follow the link in my signature and read the troubleshooting steps you should following, including finding the log file and uploading it to a file sharing site so you can post the link here.  Else there's very little that can be done to help you.

Calm down baby! The problem is solved. It was a toolbar addon problem. Thank you for advice, next time i`ll make the way you said

On 5/8/2020 at 12:16 AM, linuxgurugamer said:

The version you should be using is 0.3.6.1, it works for both 1.8 and 1.9

Which means, it works for 1.9.1?

1 hour ago, FahmiRBLXian said:

Which means, it works for 1.9.1?

In general, the minor point updates to KSP are bug fixes only.  Mods made for a major point release will work on all the minor point releases.

Which was just a long way to answer the question, but I wanted you to understand the differences between major and minor point releases
